name: dl
summary: The `<dl>` HTML element represents a description list. The element encloses a list of groups of terms (specified using the dt element) and descriptions (provided by dd elements). Common uses for this element are to implement a glossary or to display metadata (a list of key-value pairs).
contentCategories: Flow content, and if the `<dl>` element's children include one name-value group, palpable content.
permittedContent: Either: Zero or more groups each consisting of one or more dt elements followed by one or more dd elements, optionally intermixed with script and template elements.Or: (in WHATWG HTML, W3C HTML 5.2 and later) One or more div elements, optionally intermixed with script and template elements.
permittedParents: Any element that accepts flow content.
